name: St. Agapetus
summary: Agapetus was a young Christian who was martyred in Rome during the persecution of Aurelian. According to tradition, he was only 15 years old when he was arrested for being a Christian. He was tortured and then beheaded for refusing to renounce his faith. He is venerated as a saint and is one of the many young martyrs of the early Church who demonstrated remarkable courage.
